questions.text: A 5-year-old child is brought to a physician for assessment of intellectual disability. On examination, his IQ is found to be low. He has a flat nasal bridge, upward-slanted palpebral fissures, and short stature. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Down’s Syndrome Characteristics of Down’s Syndrome: Trisomy 21 Hypotonia Upward slanted palpebral fissures Simian crease Flat nasal bridge Low IQ Short stature.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect options:- Option: A . Fragile X Syndrome : Inactivation of FMR -1gene, Large ears, elongated face, low IQ, hyperactivity, inattention, and anxiety. Option: C . Prader Willi syndrome- deletion of 15q12 paternal origin , Hypotonia, obesity, small hands and feet, cryptorchidism, almond-shaped eyes, and flat face. Option: D. Angelman syndrome-deletion of 15q12 maternal origin , Blue eyes, thin upper lip, wide smiling mouth, and pointed chin.

questions.text: An 8-year-old child is bought to the physician by his mother as he can't perform well in academics. On examination, his mental age comes out to be 3 years. His IQ is graded as?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Moderate Intellectual Disability IQ= Mental age/chronological age×100=3/8×100= 37.5 Moderate intellectual disability=35-49

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Mild intellectual disability= 50-69 Option: C. Profound Intellectual Disability=less than 20 Option: D. Severe intellectual disability=20-34

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy was bought for evaluation for Intellectual Disability. He has a round face with hypertelorism, epicanthal folds, a broad flat nose, and low-set ears. He also has congenital heart disease. Which genetic defect is associated with this condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Partial deletion 5p The Given are the features of Cri-du-chat syndrome which occurs because of partial deletion of 5p.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A. Trisomy 21- Down syndrome (typical phenotype includes hypotonia, upward slanted palpebral fissures, simian crease, flat nasal bridge, low IQ, short stature). Option: B. Deletion of 15q12 paternal origin is Prader-Willi syndrome ( compulsive eating behavior and often obesity, intellectual disability, hypogonadism, small stature, hypotonia, and small hands and feet). Option: D. Inactivation of FMR-1 Gene is seen in Fragile X Syndrome (typical phenotype includes a large, long head and ears, short stature, hyperextensible joints, and postpubertal macroorchidism).
